sage.camera.controllers

Class ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.controllers.AbstractCameraController
      • sage.camera.controllers.ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICameraController

    public class ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController
extends AbstractCameraController
    This class extends the AbstractCameraController class. This class controls the virtual ICamera such that it functions as a "third-person orbit camera" common in third-person video games such as MMOs and RPGs. This class controls the orientation of the camera such that it orbits around the camera controllers SceneNode target, and it is capable of rotating the target if certain input components are enabled. The controller does NOT control the position of the target which it is attached to.

    NOTE: This class uses a large portion of the source code from Dr. John Clevenger's ThirdPersonCameraController in the sage.input package.

    Author:
    John Clevenger, Kenneth Barnett

      Causes the camera to start "snapping back" to its original azimuth.
      void update(float time)
      Updates this ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController by determining the current target position, setting a new camera position based on the target position and the current azimuth, elevation, and distance values for the camera (that is, the current position of the camera relative to the target), calculating the snapback position of the azimuth, and forcing the camera to look at the target node from its new position.

      • ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController

        protected ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController()

      • ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController

        public ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController(ICamera camera,
                                        SceneNode target,
                                        IInputManager inputMgr,
                                        java.lang.String inputControllerName)
        Constructs a ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController which controls the specified ICamera and it attached to a SceneNode target.
        Parameters:
        camera - - The camera to control
        target - - The target the controller is attached to
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        inputControllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the third-person orbit camera

    • Method Detail

      • getIsSnapbackEnabled

        public boolean getIsSnapbackEnabled()
        Returns true if camera "snapback" is enabled; false if it is disabled.

      • enableSnapback

        public void enableSnapback()
        Enables camera "snapback". Snapback is when the camera will move back to its original azimuth when the target moves.

      • disableSnapback

        public void disableSnapback()
        Disables camera "snapback". Snapback is when the camera will move back to its original azimuth when the target moves.

      • getIsSnappingBack

        public boolean getIsSnappingBack()
        Returns true if the camera is currently in the process of "snapping back" to it original azimuth; false otherwise.

      • setSnapbackSpeed

        public void setSnapbackSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the speed at which camera "snapback" occurs.

      • startSnapback

        public void startSnapback()
        Causes the camera to start "snapping back" to its original azimuth. This can only happen if "snapback" is enabled. To enable "snapback" call enableSnapback().

      • getTargetLookAtOffset

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getTargetLookAtOffset()
        Returns the target offset; that is, the offset amount in the world "up" direction above the target SceneNode which defines the point at which the camera looks.
        Returns:
        the target look at offset

      • setTargetLookAtOffset

        public void setTargetLookAtOffset(graphicslib3D.Vector3D targetLookAtOffset)
        Parameters:
        targetLookAtOffset - A Vector3D specifying the offset from the target SceneNode where the camera should point

      • getMaxDistance

        public float getMaxDistance()
        Returns the current maximum distance which the camera is allowed to be moved away from the target SceneNode.
        Returns:
        - the maximum distance the camera is allowed to be away from the target

      • setMaxDistance

        public void setMaxDistance(float maxDistance)
        Sets the maximum distance which the camera is allowed to be moved away from the target. maxDistance must be greater than or equal to minDistance, the minimum distance from the camera to the target; if the specified maxDistance is less than the current minDistance then calling this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        maxDistance - - the maximum distance allowed between the camera and the target.
        See Also:
        setMinDistance(float)

      • getMinDistance

        public float getMinDistance()
        Returns the current minimum allowed distance between the camera and the target.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance the camera is allowed to be from the target

      • setMinDistance

        public void setMinDistance(float minDistance)
        Sets the minimum allowed distance between the camera and the target. If the specified minDistance is less than 0 or greater than the current maxDistance then this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        minDistance - - the minimum allowed distance between the camera and the target
        See Also:
        setMaxDistance(float)

      • getDistance

        public float getDistance()
        Returns the current distance between the camera and the target.

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(float distance)
        Sets the distance between the camera and the target; that is, moves the camera to be at the specified distance from the target. If the specified distance is greater than the current maximum distance or less than the current minimum distance, the corresponding maximum or minimum is used instead of the specified value.

      • getMaxElevationAngle

        public float getMaxElevationAngle()
        Returns the current maximum elevation angle (in degrees) which the camera is allowed to rotate "above" the target.

      • setMaxElevationAngle

        public void setMaxElevationAngle(float maxElevationDegrees)
        Sets the maximum elevation angle (in degrees) for the camera. If the specified maximum elevation angle is less than the current minimum elevation angle or is greater than 89 degrees, this method has no effect.

      • getMinElevationAngle

        public float getMinElevationAngle()
        Returns the current minimum elevation angle (in degrees) for the camera.

      • setMinElevationAngle

        public void setMinElevationAngle(float minElevationDegrees)
        Sets the minimum elevation angle (in degrees) for the camera. If the specified minimum elevation angle is greater than the current maximum elevation angle or is less than (that is, more negative than) -89 degrees, this method has no effect.

      • getAzimuth

        public float getAzimuth()

      • getAzimuthSpeed

        public float getAzimuthSpeed()
        Returns the speed at which the azimuth of the camera can change.

      • setAzimuthSpeed

        public void setAzimuthSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the speed at which the azimuth of the camera can change.

      • getElevationSpeed

        public float getElevationSpeed()
        Returns the speed at which the elevation of the camera can change.

      • setElevationSpeed

        public void setElevationSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the speed at which the elevation of the camera can change.

      • setRotationSpeeds

        public void setRotationSpeeds(float azimuthSpeed,
                              float elevationSpeed)
        Sets the rotation speeds for changing the azimuth and elevation of the camera.
        Parameters:
        azimuthSpeed - - Speed for yawing left/right.
        elevationSpeed - - Speed for pitching up/down.

      • setInputMode

        public void setInputMode(IInputManager inputMgr,
                         java.lang.String controllerName)
        Sets which input controller the camera controller will use to manipulate the camera.
        Parameters:
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        controllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the third-person orbit camera

      • setMouseWheelSpeed

        public void setMouseWheelSpeed(float newSpeed)
        Sets the speed at which rotating the mouse wheel causes the camera to zoom in/out. The default value is 1.0. Setting a negative value reverses the direction of motion.
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - The new speed factor for the mouse wheel

      • rotateTarget

        public void rotateTarget(float rotAmount)
        Rotates the target which this camera controller is attached by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        rotAmount - - The rotation amount.

      • update

        public void update(float time)
        Updates this ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController by determining the current target position, setting a new camera position based on the target position and the current azimuth, elevation, and distance values for the camera (that is, the current position of the camera relative to the target), calculating the snapback position of the azimuth, and forcing the camera to look at the target node from its new position. This method should be called (directly or indirectly) once each time around the application's game loop.
        Parameters:
        time - - amount of time since last update, in msec
